node.title: Moana Pasifika's Covid postponed matches re-scheduled
node.description: Moana Pasifika will play two mid-week games for their previously postponed Super Rugby Pacific matches against the Blues and the Chiefs.

node.title: The price of ecocide: Govt urged to support criminalisation
node.description: A conservation group is calling on the government to push for mass environmental destruction, or ecocide, to be declared a crime by the International Criminal Court.

node.title: European Union dashes Ukraine's hopes of quick membership
node.description: European Union leaders have condemned the "unspeakable suffering" Russia is inflicting on Ukraine, despite refusing Kyiv's appeal for rapid accession to the bloc at a summit in France.

node.title: Sudden death at Kapiti Coast camp site of anti-mandate protesters
node.description: Police say they were called to a sudden death in Peka Peka earlier today. The property has been the subject of complaints from neighbours.

node.title: WHO tells Ukraine to destroy pathogens in labs to stem disease spread
node.description: The World Health Organisation was worried that "any potential spills" might spread disease among the population.

node.title: Wellington Cable Car working to prevent bird strike
node.description: Wellington Cable Car has installed special decals on the windows of its Kelburn Terminal to prevent bird strike.

node.title: Baby is first Taranaki ICU Omicron case
node.description: A baby is in intensive care with Covid-19 at New Plymouth Base Hospital. The baby is under one year old and was admitted with Covid-19 related symptoms, and moved to ICU as a precautionary measure.

node.title: Timbuktu manuscripts: Mali's ancient documents captured online
node.description: A virtual gallery to showcase Mali's cultural history has been launched, featuring tens of thousands of Timbuktu's ancient manuscripts.

node.title: Police name man found dead at rural property south of Nelson
node.description: Police have named a 56-year-old man found dead at a rural property in Hope on Wednesday.

node.title: Ross Taylor included in NZ Eleven team to take on Dutch
node.description: Retiring Black Cap Ross Taylor will feature for the New Zealand XI against Netherlands in Napier next week ahead of his final ODI series.

node.title: Revealed: The cost of pursuing Rotorua’s Māori ward local bill
node.description: The pursuit of a bill to allow an equal number of Māori and general ward seats in Rotorua has so far cost ratepayers more than $46,500.

node.title: Covid-19 briefing: 'People need to remain vigilant' - Auckland health leaders
node.description: Auckland health authorities remain cautiously optimistic that the Omicron outbreak may have peaked in NZ's biggest city, even though 601 of the 856 people in hospital with Covid-19 are in Auckland.

node.title: Covid-19 update: Seven new deaths reported, 20,989 new community cases
node.description: Seven more people with Covid-19 have died in New Zealand - the highest number of daily deaths the country has seen in this outbreak - with 20,989 new community cases reported today.

node.title: Failures, racism at University of Otago laid bare
node.description: In a letter to all university staff, Prof David Murdoch promised creating change would be his "highest priority" following the brutal review of allegations of racism at the School of Physical…

node.title: U.S. to revoke Russia favored trade status, warns Putin may seize companies' assets
node.description: Meanwhile, on Capitol Hill, the Senate approved a $13.6 billion emergency package of military and humanitarian aid for besieged Ukraine and its European allies

node.title: Tauranga council commission extended to July 2024
node.description: The Tauranga City Council commission will stay in place until July 2024, another 21 months longer than originally intended.

node.title: Oil prices plunge as UAE supports supply boost
node.description: The move could ease a supply crunch as the West and allies shun Russian oil.

node.title: No breakthrough in Russia-Ukraine talks as civilians endure bombardments
node.description: Hundreds of thousands of civilians remain trapped in Ukrainian cities sheltering from Russian air raids and shelling, as Russia-Ukraine talks fail to bring respite in the conflict.

node.title: Ratepayers bite back over plans for 9.4 percent average rate rise
node.description: Ashburton District Council's "no frills' budget still delivers the biggest rate rise in over a decade - and it hasn't gone down well with the public.

node.title: Hector's dolphin calf found dead on West Coast
node.description: Eleven of the endangered species have been found dead around the South Island since November - eight of them calves.

node.title: Senate approves $1.5 trillion bill that includes Ukraine aid
node.description: The Senate approved the $1.5 trillion legislation by a 68-31 bipartisan margin.

node.title: Russia calls U.N. meeting on U.S. "biological activities" – U.S. says "false flag"
node.description: Russia "has a track record of falsely accusing the West of the very violations that Russia itself is perpetrating," a U.S. spokesperson said.

node.title: U.S. intends to designate Colombia as major non-NATO ally
node.description: Colombia would join more than a dozen countries on the major non-NATO ally list.

node.title: Week in Politics: Christopher Luxon's tax tactics pay off
node.description: Analysis - Christopher Luxon's attacks on the government over the cost of living and his promise to cut taxes pays off as National overtakes Labour in the latest poll.

node.title: Concern over rise in Omicron sub-variant in NSW
node.description: New South Wales authorities are concerned at the spread of an Omicron sub-variant of Covid-19, which is believed to be driving rising case numbers in the Australian state.

node.title: Team investigating Taupō homicide seek sightings of silver car
node.description: Police investigating the death of a man at a motel complex in Taupō are appealing for sightings of a silver sedan and its occupants.

node.title: Wellington not at risk despite latest firetruck breakdown - FENZ
node.description: The Wellington region has been left with no coverage by large firetrucks this week after the latest breakdown.

node.title: Emilio Delgado, who played Luis on "Sesame Street" for 45 years, dies at 81
node.description: As Luis, Delgado, a Mexican American, got to play an ordinary, non-stereotypical Latino character at a time when such depictions were few and far between on TV, for adults or children.

node.title: West Coast DHB slashes home-care
node.description: Some elderly, disabled and frail housebound West Coast residents have had their home-based care services cut for up to three months, apparently due to Covid-19.

node.title: Fonterra ends joint venture in India citing Covid-19 disruptions
node.description: The 50-50 joint venture got underway in 2018 and saw Fonterra launch the Dreamery brand, which included a range of yogurt and milkshakes made using Indian milk.
